english: to exempt; to excuse; to avoid; to spare

etymology.description: Pictogram: a man wearing a ceremonial hat; later borrowed for abstract meanings; original sense preserved in 冕.
etymology.interpretation: Originally depicted a person wearing a ceremonial crown, denoting that concrete object. Over time it was loaned to write the verbal idea ‘to avoid/exempt,’ while 冕 kept the crown meaning.

examples.chinese: 免税政策帮助小企业(免稅政策幫助小企業)。
examples.english: The tax-exemption policy helps small businesses.

examples.chinese: 老师说这次作业就免交了(老師說這次作業就免交了)。
examples.pinyin: Lǎoshī shuō zhè cì zuòyè jiù miǎn jiāo le.
examples.english: The teacher said this assignment can be waived.

examples.chinese: 为了安全，尽量免去不必要的出行(為了安全，盡量免去不必要的出行)。
examples.pinyin: Wèile ānquán, jǐnliàng miǎnqù bú bìyào de chūxíng.
examples.english: For safety, try to avoid unnecessary outings.
